other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is distended with a positive sonographic sign noted on exam. There is cholelithiasis as well as trace pericholecystic fluid. The gallbladder wall measures 4 mm in thickness. There is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The common bile duct is prominent, measuring 7 mm. No focal liver lesions are visualized. The pancreas is unremarkable.
